Anggaran Pilkada 2020 untuk 265 Daerah Capai Rp 9,8 Triliun
05 Nov 2019, 20:24 by Dwi Andayani
Jakarta - Komisi Pemilihan Umum (KPU) mendata jumlah anggaran Naskah Perjanjian Hibah Daerah (NPHD) untuk Pilkada 2020. KPU mengatakan total anggaran yang telah disetujui sebanyak Rp 9,8 triliun untuk saat ini.
"Disetujui dan sudah ditandatangani NPHD-nya itu sebanyak Rp 9,8 triliun," ujar Ketua KPU Arief Budiman di Gedung KPU, Jl Imam Bonjol, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Arief menjelaskan jumlah anggaran merupakan hasil penandatanganan NPHD di 265 daerah. Sebelumnya anggaran yang diusulkan sebanyak Rp 11,7 triliun.
"Sudah tanda tangan NPHD itu 265 daerah, dengan usulan yang diajukan oleh penyelenggara pemilu atau KPU sebesar Rp 11,7 triliun," kata Arief.
Berdasarkan data KPU, jumlah anggaran Rp 9,8 triliun itu terdiri dari 9 provinsi dan 256 kabupaten/kota. Untuk 9 provinsi, anggaran yang disetujui sebanyak Rp 1.3 triliun. Sementara di 256 kabupaten/kota anggaran yang disetujui sebanyak Rp 8,4 triliun.
Diketahui, Pilkada 2020 akan digelar secara serntak di 270 daerah. Namun tersisa 5 daerah yang belum menandatangani NPHD.
Kelima daerah tersebut adalah Simalungun, Solok, Solok Selatan, Tanah Datar dan Pangkejene Kepulauan. Kelima daerah mengusulkan anggaran sebanyak Rp 198,2 miliar.

The 2020 regional election budget for 265 regions reaches Rp 9.8 trillion
05 Nov 2019, 20:24 by Dwi Andayani
Jakarta - The General Election Commission (KPU) recorded the total budget of the Regional Grant Agreement (NPHD) Manuscript for the 2020 elections. The KPU said the total approved budget was Rp. 9.8 trillion at present.
"It was approved and the NPHD was signed as much as Rp. 9.8 trillion," said KPU Chairman Arief Budiman at the KPU Building, Jl Imam Bonjol, Central Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
Arief explained that the budget amount was the result of the signing of NPHD in 265 regions. Previously the proposed budget was Rp 11.7 trillion.
"The NPHD has signed 265 regions, with proposals submitted by the election organizer or KPU of Rp 11.7 trillion," Arief said.
Based on KPU data, the total budget of Rp. 9.8 trillion consists of 9 provinces and 256 districts / cities. For 9 provinces, the approved budget was Rp 1.3 trillion. While in 256 regencies / cities the approved budget was Rp. 8.4 trillion.
It is known, the 2020 elections will be held simultaneously in 270 regions. But the remaining 5 regions have not yet signed the NPHD.
The five regions are Simalungun, Solok, South Solok, Tanah Datar and Pangkejene Kepulauan. The five regions proposed a budget of Rp 198.2 billion.
